newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: DUTCH SHELL CUTS GASOLINE, DIESEL PRICES.
newsitem.headline: DUTCH SHELL CUTS GASOLINE, DIESEL PRICES.

text.p: Royal Dutch/Shell unit Shell Nederland BV said on Tuesday it will cut its retail prices for gasolines and diesel in the Netherlands by one cent per litre with effect from April 3.
The move reflects changes in international product prices and the value of the dollar against the guilder, Shell said.

From Thursday the price of premium unleaded gasoline at Shell's self-service stations goes down to 2.10 guilders per litre. The price of premium with lead substitute falls to 2.17 guilders and that of Euro regular unleaded to 2.05 guilders.
The recommended price for diesel goes down to 1.448 guilders per litre, Shell said.
